article:

For the first time Ruth Ann   _   if she had the strength to keep Lora from getting her own way. As Lora grew up, Ruth Ann would do anything for her. "If Lora wanted something I would be   _   that she got it," she recalled.
Lora's father had left the   _   when Lora was 15. A year later Ruth Ann married a Christian man named Wayne.
When Lora was 20 years old, she   _   Scott Mesker, and the early years of their married life were plainful and exhausting. As college students, Scott had three jobs and Lora worked on campus.   _   the birth of their son. Josh, the pressures became overwhelming. Scott and Lora became   _   in the same household.
Coming from a divorced home, Lora knew her choices.   _   she had been a Christian since childhood, some of her best friends advised, "  _   will forgive you if you get a divorce."
Lora knew that her mom   _   let her come home with the baby.   After all  , her mom would do anything for her.
Ruth Ann knew Lora's marriage was in   _  , and had discussed the situation with Wayne and he   _   that Ruth Ann should not come to Lora's rescue. Lora needed to make a commitment to her marriage.
Ruth Ann had not always   _   to Wayne when Lora was a teenager, but she would now. She could not   _   Lora taking her young son through the   _   of divorce.
As she talked with Lora on the phone, she sensed that God was telling her not to   _   to Lora's request to move home. So she reluctantly said, "I just can't   _   you come home. You love Scott. You have to take a stand and make this work!"
Lora was in   _  . "How could Mom do this to me?" she wondered. What she didn't see was Ruth Ann's body   _   from uncontrollable weeping.
